Definition: Operator that evaluates the function name on the left-hand-side (LHS) of the opening parentheses using the arguments enclosed by the parentheses
Infix operator that assigns an object on the right-hand-side (RHS) to a name on the left-hand-side (LHS) -- this should be used for global assignments!
Infix operator that assigns an object on the right-hand-side (RHS) to a name on the left-hand-side (LHS) -- this should not be used for global assignments!
Infix operator that generates a regular sequence of adjacent values
Infix operator that extracts the values associated with a name (RHS) from a recursive object (LHS)
Prefix logical operator (not)
Infix arithmetic operator (subtract) or prefix negative symbol operator
Infix arithmetic operator (multiply)
Infix arithmetic operator (divide)
Attach the package environment for a given package to the current R session
Return the number of rows (i.e., observations) in a data frame as a one-value integer vector
Count the number of unique observations in an atomic vector
Add or modify a column in a data frame
Convert a value in a vector to NA
Generate a sequence of integer values from 1 to the number of rows in a data frame
Subset columns in a data frame by name (without quotes!)
Mutate a data frame while subsetting the columns to those specified in the function
The pipe operator passes the output of the LHS argument to the function on the right
Read an RDS file into R
Replace an NA value in a vector with a different value
